info.game_comments:
1998 College Championship final game 2.
From Zellerbach Auditorium at the University of California-Berkeley.

(1, 1).clue: With no "Time to Kill", he recently turned out another legal thriller, "The Street Lawyer"

(2, 1).clue: After dabbing this behind your ears, put some on your light bulb to make your room smell nice

(3, 1).clue: This striped mammal can fire numerous jets of its foul-smelling liquid before it has to "reload"

(4, 1).clue: This comedian has daughter Melissa by her side when she critiques clothes at the Oscars

(5, 1).clue: Singer heard here, who also starred in the film("Viva Las Vegas")

(6, 1).clue: Raise a number to the third power, or a common form for ice & sugar

(1, 2).clue: This author is famous for giving readers "Goosebumps" & leading them down "Fear Street"

(2, 2).clue: It may make you look "Hefty", but Heloise says a plastic one of these is a great substitute for a raincoat

(3, 2).clue: This type of rattlesnake seen here is named for the way it moves

(4, 2).clue: Hunter Tylo won $5 million after she was dropped from this drama while pregnant with daughter Izabella

(5, 2).clue: Once Miss America, she's gone from hosting "The Soul of VH1" to starring in "Soul Food"

(6, 2).clue: The average value of a set of numbers, or cruel

(1, 3).clue: In this Stephen King novel, author Paul Sheldon is held hostage by his No. 1 fan

(2, 3).clue: Many students make these out of concrete blocks & wood; to dress them up, cover the blocks with cloth

(3, 3).clue: Some smaller species of this largest marsupial live in the trees of New Guinea

(4, 3).clue: This TV personality rises early, even for a mother of 2

(5, 3).clue: Dr. Frankenstein, played by this "Police" man, gave Jennifer Beals every breath she took as "The Bride"

(6, 3).clue: The operation of combining numbers, or a wing appended to a building

(1, 4).clue: Sinclair Lewis dedicated this book about a real estate broker to Edith Wharton

(2, 4).clue: If the eraser on your pencil smudges, rub it a few times with this manicure utensil

(3, 4).clue: Creature seen here in one of its more familiar "colors"

(4, 4).clue: Afeni Shakur, a member of the Black Panthers, named her son this, for an Inca chief

(5, 4).clue: The Lemonheads' Evan Dando & this former Blondie singer were in 1995's "Heavy"

(6, 4).clue: An angle greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees, or lacking sharpness of intellect

(1, 5).clue: This author of "All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten" is an ordained Unitarian minister

(2, 5).clue: Wrap some wide rubber bands around bottles of this & they won't slip out of your hands in the shower

(3, 5).clue: Bred in captivity, dozens of these rare "masked" weasels were introduced into the Wyoming wilderness in 1991

(4, 5).clue: On a plane showing "One Fine Day", this star wouldn't let her daughter see mommy kiss George Clooney

(5, 5).clue: Gangsta rapper Ice Cube played Doughboy, an ex-con living in south central L.A., in this 1991 film

(6, 5).clue: A trigonometric function that equals sine/cosine, or a conversational digression

(1, 1).clue: 2 years after exploring the Northwest with William Clark, he was named gov. of the Louisiana territory

(2, 1).clue: This prophet's accomplishments include being "vomited out" of a great fish

(3, 1).clue: There may be a second & a second second one of these people, called "A.D."s, who keep things moving

(4, 1).clue: This carbon compound found in auto exhaust can prevent body tissues from getting oxygen

(5, 1).clue: Ancient city seen here (the Colosseum is in the middle) in a National Geographic illustration

(1, 2).clue: This group of volunteers, created on Mar. 1, 1961, works to improve living conditions in other nations

(2, 2).clue: Reclusive Ezekiel trimmed this with a sword & wove the trimmings into his robe

(3, 2).clue: Piece of machinery run by a genny operator

(4, 2).clue: This mineral is the most stable form of carbon, though not when you sharpen your pencil too fine

(5, 2).clue: The Vogalonga, an annual regatta seen here, takes place in this city

(1, 3).clue: On April 24, 1980 an attempt to rescue 53 hostages in this capital city was called off

(2, 3).clue: Nathan's grim story about a slaughtered lamb made this king feel bad for the death of Uriah

(3, 3).clue: A "dresser" helps actors with costumes; this type of "dresser" gives the film its props

(4, 3).clue: This isotope with a half-life of about 5,730 years is used to date organisms that didn't last quite so long

(5, 3).clue: Mayor Yuri Luzhkov led the recent effort to restore this city's cathedral, seen here

(1, 4).clue: 'Ullo, Gouverneur!  This signer of the Constitution gave the document its final wording

(2, 4).clue: Elijah told Ahab that this wicked woman, Ahab's wife, would be eaten by dogs...& she was

(3, 4).clue: The credits of "The Flintstones" report none of these "were harmed in the making of" the movie

(4, 4).clue: The structures of compounds like this one, C6H6, have a certain "ring" to them

(5, 4).clue: Caribbean island seen here (with a volcanic eruption) in a recent photo

(1, 5).clue: On Dec. 9, 1992, the first group of U.S. Marines arrived in this African nation to restore order

(2, 5).clue: Elisha cured a general of this skin disease, then gave it to a servant

(3, 5).clue: "The Naked Gun 2 1/2" credits a "loaded filmer" right after this person who works with the camera

(4, 5).clue: Plant products called alkaloids contain carbon & this element, the next one up on the periodic table

(5, 5).clue: This German university city is seen here behind the fossil named for it

(0, 0).clue: Under current succession laws, this former university head is the last woman in line for the U.S. presidency
